title: Randomized higher-order tensor renormalization group
abstract: The higher-order tensor renormalization group (HOTRG) is a fundamental method to calculate the physical quantities by using a tensor network representation. This method is based on the singular value decomposition (SVD) to take the contraction of all indices in the network with an approximation. For the SVD, randomized singular value decomposition (R-SVD) is a powerful method to reduce computational costs of SVD. However, HOTRG with the randomized method is not established. We propose a randomized HOTRG method in a dimension $d$ with the computational cost $O(D^{3d})$ depending on the truncated bond dimension $D$. We also introduce the minimally-decomposed TRG (MDTRG) as the R-HOTRG on the tensor of order $d+1$ with $O(D^{2d + 1})$ and a triad representation of the MDTRG (Triad-MDTRG) with $O(D^{d+3})$. The results from these formulations are consistent with the HOTRG result with the same truncated bond dimension $D$.
